options.name: -Command
tip: U: -Command <-|string|scriptBlock>
Executes the specified command (and any parameters) as if they were typed at the Windows PowerShell command prompt, then exits unless NoExit is specified.
The value of Command can be "-", a string, or a script block.

options.name: -ConfigurationName
tip: U: -ConfigurationName <string>
Specifies the configuration endpoint that runs Windows PowerShell.
This can be any endpoint registered on the local computer, including the default Windows PowerShell remote endpoint or a custom endpoint with specific user role capabilities.

options.name: -EncodedCommand
tip: U: -EncodedCommand <Base64EncodedCommand>
Accepts a command as a base-64 encoded string.
Use this parameter to submit commands to Windows PowerShell that require complex quoting or braces.

options.name: -ExecutionPolicy
tip: U: -ExecutionPolicy <ExecutionPolicy>
Sets the default execution policy for the current session and saves it in the $env:PSExecutionPolicyPreference environment variable.
This parameter does not change the execution policy set in the Windows PowerShell registry.

options.name: -File
tip: U: -File <filePath> <args>
Runs the specified script in the local scope (dot-sourced), so that the functions and variables created in the script are available in the current session.
Provide the script file path and any arguments.
File must be the last parameter in the command, as all characters following the File parameter name are interpreted as the script file path followed by script arguments.

options.name: -InputFormat
tip: U: -InputFormat <string>
Describes the format of data sent to Windows PowerShell.
Valid values are "Text" (text strings) or "XML" (serialized CLIXML format).

options.name: -Mta
tip: Starts the shell using a multi-threaded apartment.

options.name: -NoExit
tip: Does not exit after running startup commands.

options.name: -NoLogo
tip: Hides the copyright banner at startup.

options.name: -NonInteractive
tip: Does not present an interactive prompt to the user.

options.name: -NoProfile
tip: Does not load Windows PowerShell profiles.

options.name: -OutputFormat
tip: U: -OutputFormat <string>
Specifies how output from Windows PowerShell is formatted.
Valid values are "Text" (text strings) or "XML" (serialized CLIXML format).

options.name: -PSConsoleFile
tip: U: -PSConsoleFile <file>
Loads the specified Windows PowerShell console file.
To create a console file, use Export-Console in Windows PowerShell.

options.name: -Sta
tip: Starts the shell using a single-threaded apartment.
Single-threaded apartment (STA) is the default setting.

options.name: -Version
tip: U: -Version <version>
Starts the specified version of Windows PowerShell.
Provide a version number as an argument, such as "-version 2.0".

options.name: -WindowStyle
tip: U: -WindowStyle <style>
Sets the display style of the Windows PowerShell window.

next.name: Hidden
tip: Hidden window

tip: Maximized window

tip: Minimized window

tip: Show the help.
